Package domain.block

Class Block

java.lang.Object
domain.block.Block
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConditionBlock, FunctionDefinitionBlock, SequenceBlock
public abstract class Block
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract class of Blocks that has a presentation block and a surrounding block.
Version:
4.0
Author:
Andreas Awouters Thomas Van Erum Dirk Vanbeveren Geert Wesemael

  • Method Details

    • getPresentationBlock

      protected PresentationBlock<?> getPresentationBlock()
      Presentation of this block.
      Returns:
      The presentation of this block. Returns null if none has been set.

    • setPresentationBlock

      protected void setPresentationBlock​(PresentationBlock<?> presentationBlock)
      Set the Presentation of this block.
      Parameters:
      presentationblock - The desired presentation for this Block.

    • execute

      protected abstract Block execute​(GameController GC) throws java.lang.Exception
      Execute this block.
      Parameters:
      gameController - The GameController that executes the current block.
      Returns:
      next block in sequence
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If a block in the sequence is not executable.

    • hasValidExecutionColumn

      protected abstract boolean hasValidExecutionColumn()
      Return true if this block and entire column of blocks following this block can be executed
      Returns:
      true if this block and entire column of blocks following this block can be executed.

    • getNewBlockOfThisType

      protected abstract Block getNewBlockOfThisType()
      New block of this type without connections.
      Returns:
      A new block of the same type without any connections.

    • getAllNextBlocks

      protected java.util.List<Block> getAllNextBlocks()
      All of the blocks connected after this one.
      Returns:
      all of the blocks connected after this one.

    • getName

      protected abstract java.lang.String getName()
      The name of the block.
      Returns:
      The name of the block as a string

    • getSurroundingBlock

      protected SurroundingBlock getSurroundingBlock()
      The block surrounding this block.
      Returns:
      The surroundingBlock that surrounds this block. This block can be a conditionBlock or a sequenceBlock. If there is no surroundingBlock, null is returned.

    • setSurroundingBlock

      protected void setSurroundingBlock​(SurroundingBlock block)
      Set the surrounding block to the given block.
      Parameters:
      block - The block that is set to surround this block.

    • getNextBlock

      protected abstract Block getNextBlock()
      Get the block that is connected after this this one. This can be on the right side or below the current one.
      Returns:
      The block that is connected after this block (on the right side for conditionBlocks or on the down side of sequenceBlocks).

    • setNextBlock

      protected abstract boolean setNextBlock​(Block block)
      Set the next block to the given next block.
      Parameters:
      block - The block to become the next one.
      Returns:
      True if possible, else false.

    • removeNextBlock

      protected abstract void removeNextBlock()
      Remove the next block.

    • getBlockAbove

      protected abstract Block getBlockAbove()
      Return the block that is connected before this block. This can be on the left side or above the current one.
      Returns:
      The block that is connected before this block (on the left side for conditionBlocks or on the upper side of sequenceBlocks).

    • getLastBlock

      protected abstract Block getLastBlock()
      Return the last block of the connection chain to this block.
      Returns:
      The last block of the connection chain to this block. (Most right block for conditionBlocks and lowest block for sequenceBlocks)

    • disconnect

      protected abstract void disconnect()
      Disconnect this block from all other blocks.

    • getPrevious

      protected abstract Block getPrevious()
